snippet: Texas offers more incentives to attract business than any other state, but questions remain about who benefits more, the companies or the people of Texas.
abstract: Texas gives out about $19 billion a year in business incentives, more than any other state; it justifies its largess by pointing out it is home to half of all the private sector jobs created over last decade nationwide; further examination shows raw numbers mask a more complicated reality behind the flood of incentives and raises questions about who benefits more, businesses or people of Texas (Series: United States of Subsidies).

byline.contributor: Lisa Schwartz and Lauren D’Avolio contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Texas offers more incentives to attract business than any other state, but questions remain about who benefits more, the companies or the people of Texas.

headline.seo: Texas Business Incentives Highest in Nation
headline.main: Lines Blur as Texas Gives Industries a Bonanza
headline.print_headline: Lines Blur as Texas Gives Industries a Bonanza
